User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; InfoPath.3; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E; MALC)

Steps to reproduce:

I have previous hosted an html embed element in a splitter pane using the lex attribute, e.g. in the overlay xul:

  <vbox id="appcontent">
    <splitter id="mySplitterBar" collapsed="false"/>
    <vbox id="myPlugin" collapsed="false" persist="height">

       <html:embed id="myPluginCtrl" type="application/x-mycompany-addon" flex="1"     focusable="true" tabindex="0" xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" />
     </vbox>
  </vbox>


Actual results:

In Firefox 6 beta 1 the embedded nsplugin opens with a fixed height and doesn't resize with the splitter control. It's as if the flex="1" attribute is ignored


Expected results:

In Firefox 2.0 - 5.0 the splitter can be used to resize the ns plugin based object loaded with the html:embed tag
